word: Therefore, I cannot give my consent to have any of my books handled at the present time in the way you suggest. It would make upon the minds of some of our brethren an impression that would not be desirable. Even though the whole $30,000 of my indebtedness might be settled in the manner you propose, yet I could not give my consent.--Letter 94, 1908, pp. 1-3. (To S. N. Haskell, March 29, 1908.)
